likelihood_impact_change.explanation: Under the Delayed Transition scenario, consumer preferences may shift more rapidly towards sustainable products, leading to increased pressure on Apple to adapt its iPhone line-up accordingly. The likelihood of changes in consumer preferences increases as environmental concerns become more pronounced, while the impact of failing to meet these preferences also rises.

emerging_opportunities.description: Developing an iPhone model that utilizes sustainable materials and energy-efficient technology could attract environmentally conscious consumers.
Offering trade-in and recycling programs to promote sustainable consumer behavior around iPhones.

additional_challenges.description: The need to source sustainable materials may disrupt existing supply chains, leading to potential delays and increased costs.
Educating consumers about the benefits of sustainability in products may require significant marketing efforts and resources.

mitigation_strategies.description: Increase investment in R&D for sustainable materials and low-carbon technologies for iPhone production.
Launch programs to engage consumers about the benefits of sustainability, potentially improving brand loyalty.
Build stronger partnerships with suppliers focused on sustainability to ensure a reliable supply of sustainable materials.
